author: namngrg
content:
I'm sorry I missed the message and thanks for the reply

let’s say you have a rollup  ecosystem (eg a zkSync hyper chain ecosystem with N chains deployed). Likely these will be decentralized, with individual rollups using their own decentralized sequencers, probably many of which would use PoS for permissionless validation
Let’s say each has 100 validators
This means you need N*100 validators to secure the ecosystem, because none of the stake is shared across the ecosystem - every rollup has its own staking requirements. Naively if you add another, you also need a new validator set with more stake
Which is quite capital inefficient
So I was thinking if there is a way to solve this
